Job Title: Real Estate Development and Acquisitions Manager

Location: Kansas City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Finance, Sales

Description:
Bring your expertise in in real estate development, land acquisition, commercial brokerage, etc and join our client – a Fortune 250 real estate development company who has been #1 in their space for over 15 years!
Highlights: Open a New Division: Play a big part in building a new operation for a Fortune 500 builder that is drawing from $1 Billion+ in organic capital to withstand the typical funding risks of a start-up.Support Provided: Established sister divisions providing support to aid in successful initial community launches.Build Your Perfect Team: As a founding member of a new division, you’ll hand pick and hire a great land team.Unique multi-brand strategy: Serving all major buyer groups – entry, first time, move up, luxury and active adult, increasing number of deals this person can consider. 
What you’ll do: Find, place under contract, receive governmental approval, and close on new land assets (undeveloped land + developed lots) in the Greater Kansas City area. Work with property owners, brokers, land developers, city officials and others to secure land. Responsibilities: Plan, direct and coordinate all land acquisition activitiesCoordinate, Secure and Organize Land Acquisition LeadsReceive and provide initial response plan for all new leads from outside sourcesPerform Title and municipal research and initial “cold call” inquiry for potential land leadsProvide initial meetings with seller and/or seller’s representativeProvide all pertinent property description information, seller demands, terms, conditions and contact information to managementPrepare letters of intentMaintain close relationships with land developers, brokers, and landownersUnderwrite and analyze the financial aspects of each development opportunityCommunicate regularly with city officialsNegotiate purchase contracts with sellersPrepare memoranda and other documentation and analytics for corporate approval for land buys  What you’ll need: 5+ years of successful experience acquiring land for ground-up construction projects (residential preferred).Salesmanship and successful experience developing relationships. Be able to discuss a memorable deal you got across the line, and how.Have led numerous iterations of underwriting a potential development project including utilizing a proforma.Experienced in the use of market research tools and knowledge of GIS mapping applications and Google Earth.Working knowledge of MO/KS zoning and land use practices, development standards, and utility solutions would be a big plus.Ability to read and interpret lot plans, plat plans.Strong MS Office skills (Excel, Outlook, etc).

Experience Level (if available): Director
